pageProps.content:
Experience

Welcome to Arusha! The city’s bustling streets, buzzing markets & vibrant nightlife offers visitors a wide selection of boutique-style hotels, culture & endless activities.
While the city is often only a stopover for many as it acts as the gateway to Tanzania’s greatest wildlife destinations, a day or two in the city will treat guests to an inside look at one of the country’s flourishing metropolises.
Kilimanjaro International Airport is only a short 20-minute drive from the domestic Arusha Airport, so visitors can conveniently fly directly from Zanzibar, making the Arusha region an easy add-on to a Zanzibar itinerary.

Activities

As one of the oldest towns in Tanzania, there’s plenty of things to see and do in Arusha. It’s a cultural hub with its traditional markets, museums, pulsating nightlife & an array of restaurants, offers its visitors a long list of exciting day trips & activities.
Guests can sample coffee at one of the nearby plantations, shop at a local market or do a day trip to the nearby Arusha National Park to get a ‘safari taste’ before heading off to one of Tanzania’s major wildlife destinations such as the Serengeti, Ngorongoro Crater, Tarangire National Park or Lake Manyara.
Other day tours & activities include cycling along the river to local villages, swimming in natural hot springs, horse riding, canoeing or playing a round of golf.

When to travel

Arusha city is a year-round travel destination, although it has 2 wet seasons & 2 dry seasons. The long, rainy season is from March to May, & most of the annual rainfall occurs in these months so may not be the best time to see the top attractions in Arusha. The short rainy season is in November & December. The long, dry season is from June to October, & August is typically the driest month of the year. The short, hot dry season is in January & February with sporadic rains.
The best time to visit Arusha National Park is from June to October, during the dry season when it is easier to spot wildlife.
The best months to climb Mount Meru are from June to February & the best climbing seasons for Mount Kilimanjaro are from January to February and June to October. June through October is the peak climbing season due to the summer holidays, so there are more trekkers on the mountain.

subfolders.title: Arusha Coffee Lodge
subfolders.description: With a beautiful setting on the outskirts of Arusha on Tanzania’s largest coffee plantation, Arusha Coffee Lodge boasts a luxurious historic atmosphere & glorious views of towering Mount Meru. The lodge is located just 5 minutes from Arusha Airport & the ideal stopover before or after a Tanzania safari.

subfolders.title: Hamerkop House by Lemala
subfolders.description: Hamerkop House by Lemala is a 3-bedroom villa situated on the private Kilimanjaro Golf & Wildlife Estate, halfway between Kilimanjaro International Airport & Arusha. Small & intimate, complete with experienced chefs, a private airstrip, swimming pool & spa – the villa is an ideal choice for discerning travelers looking for a luxurious escape before or after a Tanzania safari.

subfolders.title: Hatari Lodge
subfolders.description: Located at the slopes of Mount Meru in Arusha National Park’s Ngurdoto Crater – also known as a ‘little Serengeti’ – Hatari Lodge boasts eclectic décor, spectacular wildlife viewing & a range of exciting safari activities. The nearby Momela Lakes are home to a variety of wildlife, including waterfowls, lazy hippos, black-&-white colobus monkeys & pink flamingos.

subfolders.title: Kili Villa
subfolders.description: Kili Villa comprises 3 exclusive use, fully staffed retreats situated within a spectacular golf & wildlife estate in Arusha. Kili Villa has become the discerning traveler’s start & end to their safari adventure & can be reached by private airstrip or a 30-minute transfer from Arusha & Kilimanjaro Airports.

subfolders.title: Legendary Lodge
subfolders.description: Legendary Lodge boasts a beautiful setting on a fragrant working coffee farm among lush tropical gardens on the outskirts of Arusha. This tranquil retreat offers a home-away-from-home experience, sublime cuisine & exceptional service.

subfolders.title: Machweo Wellness Retreat
subfolders.description: Perched on Namasi Hill in a beautiful estate’s lush gardens, Machweo Wellness Retreat is a luxury boutique hotel with an ideal location on the outskirts of Arusha – Tanzania’s gateway to the Norther safari circuit. This luxurious boutique hotel is a private sanctuary to the discerning traveler hoping to escape the hustle & bustle before or after a Tanzania safari.

subfolders.title: Shu'Mata Camp
subfolders.description: Set on a craggy hill at the foot of Mount Kilimanjaro in the heart of the Maasai Steppe, Shu’Mata Camp is an intimate safari haven, offering awe-inspiring views of the south Amboseli savanna & Africa’s highest mountain. Shu’Mata means ‘heaven’ in the local Maa language - & aptly so – because it is so close to Kilimanjaro that on a clear night, guests might see details of its glaciers at the summit, which is the highest in all of Africa.
